description:
And we start with writer and producer Anthony McCarten whose film, The Theory of Everything, has four nominations including Best Actor nod for Eddie Redmayne scorchingly tipped to win for his performance as Professor Stephen Hawking. McCarten has two nominations for Best Film and Best Adapted Screenplay of Jane Hawking's memoir about her marriage to the theoretical physicist. It's a film many have found moving for being more interested in the minutiae and nuances of family life as it is in any scientific Eureka moments. I spoke to Anthony slightly worse for wear the morning after he'd won the BAFTA for his screenplay. And he told me that the accolades and nominations were a reward for ten years' hard work.

"In 2004, I read Jane Hawking's remarkable autobiography that really showed the journey she'd been on which was initially meant to have been a two-year sort of deal that Stephen had been given a diagnosis of only two years to live. And on that basis, she had said, 'Yes, well, I'll make those two years as rich as we can and I love you.' Of course, as we know, the prognosis was wrong, thankfully, and this turned into a 27-year marriage and Jane very, very movingly, I think, describes that journey, the highs, the lows, and I thought that is such an extraordinary one-of-a-kind love story."
